subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: A former associate of O. J. Mayo has told federal and N.C.A.A. investigators that U.S.C. Coach Time Floyd gave $1,000 in cash to a man who helped steer Mayo to the Trojans. Floyd did not immediately respond to the allegations, which first appeared in a Yahoo Sports report. The former associate, Louis Johnson, has told authorities that he accompanied Mayo’s handler, Rodney Guillory, to a meeting with Floyd at a Beverly Hills cafe on Feb. 14, 2007, and that Guillory emerged with an envelope stuffed with $100 bills.
